newsitem.title: ZAIRE: Pro-rebel leaflets circulate in Kinshasa.
newsitem.headline: Pro-rebel leaflets circulate in Kinshasa.

text.p: Leaflets urging the population of Zaire's capital Kinshasa to stay at home and display white flags to welcome Laurent Kabila's rebels have begun circulating in the teeming city, residents say.

The leaflets, purporting to come from Kabila's Alliance of Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Congo-Zaire, urged the capital's residents to stage a "stay-at-home" protest from Wednesday to Friday, the residents added.

"The pro-Kabila armed forces are already there. They are going to liberate the heart of Congo very soon," one leaflet said. "Dear population, in order to avoid a bloodbath observe a 'stay-at-home' from Wednesday May 14 to Friday May 16."
The leaflets were photocopies of a typewritten sheet.
When the battle came, residents should stay home to avoid being hit by stray bullets or being considered looters, one said.

The armed forces, it added, should remain in their camps to be given a role by the rebel alliance and fly white flags as a sign of peace. Uniformed soldiers in the streets would be considered as opponents of the alliance.
It urged residents to avoid the city centre and the edges of the city and sing songs of joy as a sign of peace. They should also fly white flags from their homes, it said.
Embattled President Mobutu Sese Seko is due to meet rebel leader Laurent Kabila on Wednesday on a South African ship.
South Africa's deputy president, Thabo Mbeki, who is trying to avert a bloody battle for Kinshasa, said that Wednesday's meeting could be the last hope for a peaceful settlement.
